com.engine.coreObject

Class CoreObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.engine.coreObject.CoreObject
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Entity, Pickup, Tile

    public abstract class CoreObject
extends java.lang.Object

    CoreObject

    A core object is anything in the project that can move or be interacted with. Anything that requires more features than the basics of a core object should be a separate class that extends this one. For example, Player.java or Tile.java.

    Basic Functionality:

    The base functionality of a core object is as follows:
    • X and Y positions in the world
    • X and Y velocities that control movement
    • The ability to fall downwards in the Y direction due to gravity
    • Basic collisions with other core objects and tiles
    • The ability to be clicked on and perform an action
    Author:
    Ryan Hochmuth

    • Method Detail

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Updates this core object's fields every tick based on the core clock's fps.

        This tick method updates the object's position based on it's velocity. It then tells the object to act as if it is falling if it reacts to gravity.

      • fall

        public void fall()
        Update this core object as though it was falling. An object is considered to be falling at all times it is affected by gravity.

        This method changes the object's y velocity based on the gravity if it is affected by gravity. If this object collides, a collision check is also performed.

      • renderObject

        public void renderObject(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Render the graphic of this core object at it's x and y position.
        Parameters:
        g - - the java graphics to draw with

        public void altCollided(int collision)

        public void clicked()
        Called when this CoreObject is clicked.

      • update

        public void update()
        This is a forced update to this core object. Typically called from a tile update to update this core objects fall state.
